The actual potential is probably on the order of 5,000 to 10,000 at
present, including staff members of NAE3 active members and closed circuit
installations, and the large number of teachers already engaged in TV and
radio teaching and utilization. During the interim period while professional
standards and standards for membership are being developed, it is expected
that this individual membership category will continue to increase gradually,
in spite of the absence at present of such standards. Eventual standards, to
be developed, can therefore probably not be made retro-actlvely effective.
This appears to be true in the development of earlier professions as well.
However, during the period of the proposed grant project, it is our hope
that the status and qualifications of educational broadcasters and the teachers
who use these powerful and influential instruments of education, will become
increasingly important to educational administrators. This is in turn related
to the eilort of the NAEB to achieve self-support.
)
